===Religion as a source of moral authority===
 
===Religion as a source of moral authority===
 
{{Expand section|date=June 2008}}
 
{{Expand section|date=June 2008}}
  +   +
{{main|divine command theory}}
     
Many religions provide moral guidelines for their followers. They believe that the divine has instructed them with a way to live; following these rules will lead to a good life, good social structure, and closer communion with the divine.
